alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 11:32PM CDT until April 07 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR EASTERN CLAYTON...CENTRAL GRANT AND SOUTHERN CRAWFORD COUNTIES... At 1132 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Prairie Du Chien to near Bloomington to near Holy Cross, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Bloomington around 1135 PM CDT. Boscobel and Fennimore around 1155 PM CDT. Lancaster around 1200 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Big H Campground, Highway 61 And County T, Mount Ida, Harris Ridge, Turkey River, Highways 60 And 61 and Beetown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
